newsitem.title: USA: Belarus picks Price Waterhouse as financial adviser.
newsitem.headline: Belarus picks Price Waterhouse as financial adviser.

text.p: The former Soviet republic of Belarus on Thursday announced that it has picked the U.S. accounting firm Price Waterhouse as its official financial adviser for a broad range of economic development programmes.
The Belarus Embassy in Washington said First Deputy Prime Minister Pyotry Prokopovich and Price Waterhouse partner James Waddell recently signed a memorandum of understanding.

Under the agreement, Price Waterhouse will advise the government of Belarus on privatisation of large and medium-sized state-owned businesses, including Belarus Telecom, financing of infrastructure projects and defence conversion ventures.
In addition, it will provide fund raising, audit and accounting services, the embassy said.
